subject: Hedge Knight In the Lists
event: Cool news from both sides of the Atlantic. The new illustrated hardcover of A KNIGHT OF THE SEVEN KINGDOMS has debuted on the NEW YORK TIMES bestseller list as #2 in hardcover fiction. Over in the UK, the British edition has landed as #3 on the TIMES list (Bernard Cornwell's new Uhtred novel is number 1, of course).     Pretty good for a collection of three previously published novellas. My thanks go out to all my friends at Bantam Spectra and Harper Voyager... and of course to Gary Gianni, whose gorgeous artwork helped make the book such a rousing success.

props.taglist: voyager, bantam spectra, bestseller lists, dunk & egg
props.crosspost_tw: Hedge Knight In the Lists http://goo.gl/95JjeJ

comments.article: This is awesome news! I'm so excited about more folks becoming familiar with this prequel to ASOIAF! Are you working on Dunk and Egg in parallel with TWOW?
Good to hear, ser! I just ordered on Amazon this morning. Now waiting impatiently for it to get here. :)
comments.subject: Muy excellante!

comments.article: I love these stories and read them all in the various anthologies in which they appear, but having them all together in one place is really cool. The pictures REALLY make them! Super fun to read. Love seeing Dunk's sigil!!
comments.subject: The pictures make it

comments.article: Don't worry about bestseller lists.I sure your "Son of Kong" is going to break them all.
comments.subject: Bestsellers !!!

comments.article: What wonderful news. Congratulations, and to the wonderful artists.
comments.subject: Cool!

comments.article:
Got it downloaded to the NOOK and can't wait to start it this weekend. Love all you write and trust me, I am old enough and geeky enough to know. (as an aside, sorry you lost to Zelazny all those years ago, but I think he is also the cream of the crop
I'll let you know when I finish, not that you give a goats bobo. :)
comments.subject: On my Nook

comments.article: Omg I'm just building a massive exhibit of your books for my future man cave

I love finally having the three stories in one book, and the illustrations really added to the experience. Kudos to Gary Gianni! It made it feel like reading one of Howard Pyle's books, if he were still around!

It's such a beautiful book. Holding off reading it right away as I'm savoring the moment. However congratulations on it's #2 positioning. It would be fun to see if HBO has intentions for this guy down the road
comments.subject: I just got mine last week

comments.article: I saw the nice coffee-table edition (hardback) in my book shop in Copenhagen, at least it felt anf looked like a coffee-table book. My point, it's really really nice!
comments.subject: Tasty...

comments.article:
I bought the hardback from the bookshop last weekend, and finished it last night. Unlike, it seems, most other people, I had never read any of the D&E stories before. I have to say, I absolutely bloody loved them! While I adore the main A Song of Ice and Fire series, there's just something about these stories; the way they marry the spirit of classic adventure tales with rich mythology and enough grit and realism to keep things grounded. At the end of a long day, this is the exactly the kind of book I want to get lost in until the small hours.

The only problem was, at the end I wanted more!
comments.subject: Congratulations!

comments.article: Is the next D&E story finished?
comments.subject: D&E

comments.article:
No.

Of course not.

If it was, it would have been published. I don't sit on finished material.
comments.subject: Re: D&E

comments.article: The illustrations are amazing.  Got a chance to meet Gary Gianni at NYCC last week, such a nice guy and very talented as well.  Was able to show my appreciation in person. Kudos to the person who made the decision to have him illustrate the book.
Will bloodraven appear again in any future dunk and egg novels?
comments.subject: Dunk and egg

comments.article: I don't know about dunk and egg novels, but he may have already re-appeared...
comments.subject: Re: Dunk and egg

comments.article: I am really frustrated on how long I wait for the book to come to Egypt

comments.subject: Other Lists

comments.article:
Hey George,

Which version of the shield on the covers would you say more accurately reflects the coloring of Dunk's shield in the books, the British or American?
The narration is unbelievably great - and the stories get better on each pass. Is Harry Lloyd going to do TWoW if Roy isn't able?
comments.subject: How's the audiobook doing?

comments.article:
First time commenting on the board. I have a question for anyone who has read "The World of Ice & Fire: The Untold History" and the three novellas of Dunk and Egg. I have been saving both books to read once I finish "A Dance with Dragons" (which should be in the very near future). My question is which book should I read after ADWD? Would it be wise to read about Dunk and Egg before reading the history or vice versa?

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Congrats on your new Bestseller, Mr. Martin!
comments.subject: What to read first?

comments.article: Read KNIGHT OF THE SEVEN KINGDOMS next.
comments.subject: Re: What to read first?

comments.article: It's a gorgeous book for wonderful stories! I'm absolutely in love with it.

I know what I am in the hum medium SUBJECT however nothing to please George , I'm from Brazil and great fan hum of His Work and More STILL actress Milla Jovovich . I wish I Hope Of this , tell me How is the Film Project in the lost land?
comments.subject: George Please tell me.

comments.subject: Way off-topic

comments.article: Huge, huge fan of Stephen King.
comments.subject: Re: Way off-topic

comments.article:
Thanks so much! I preordered for Kindle, and although I'd rather have the paper book, it was a pleasant surprise to see the book suddenly appear on my phone. Of course I binged it, so now starving for more.

I loved Tanselle, and want to meet her whole company! Any chance for Puppeteer of the Seven Kingdoms?
comments.subject: Loved the book!

comments.article: Really nice and clean design. I think it fits well. I have a question though. How important do you think cover design is to a book?

Congratulations on landing in the list!

A British question: Any idea if/when this comes out as a paperback? All the rest of my ASOIAF books are paperbacks and I'd be gutted if I had to ruin my set with just the one hardback lol. Mind you I'm tempted to get it anyway.. (the thirst is real).
comments.subject: Paperbacks?

comments.article:
It will come out as a paperback eventually, I am sure. Just when depends on a number of factors.

FWIW, the impact of the artwork will be somewhat diminished when it is shrunken down to mass market size.
comments.subject: Re: Paperbacks?
